main_text:
The Conditions, again
4. The Conditions, again
Taken separately, the conditions of Arrow’s theorem do not seem
severe. Apparently, they ask of an aggregation procedure only that it
will come up with a social preference ordering no matter what
everybody prefers (U and SO), that it will resemble
certain democratic arrangements in some ways (WP
and I), and that it will not resemble certain undemocratic
arrangements in another way (D). Taken together, though,
these conditions exclude all possibility of deriving social
preferences. It is time to consider them more closely.
